# Adopt AI Grand Palais 2025 - AI-Friendly API

> Professional REST API for the Adopt AI Grand Palais conference schedule
> 240+ sessions ‚Ä¢ 200+ speakers ‚Ä¢ Nov 25-26, 2025 ‚Ä¢ Paris

## Base URL

https://adoptai.codecrafter.fr

## Endpoints

### GET /sessions

Returns conference sessions with server-side filtering.

**Query Parameters:**
- `date` (string): Filter by date
  - Values: "2025-11-25" or "2025-11-26"
  - Example: /sessions?date=2025-11-25

- `stage` (string): Filter by stage name (exact match)
  - Values: "CEO Stage", "Mainstage South", "Mainstage North", "Mainstage East", 
            "Masterclass South", "Masterclass North", "Startup Stage"
  - Example: /sessions?stage=CEO%20Stage

- `time` (string): Filter by time of day
  - Values: "morning" (before 12:00) or "afternoon" (12:00+)
  - Example: /sessions?time=morning

- `search` (string): Full-text search in title, description, speaker names, companies
  - Example: /sessions?search=banking
  - Example: /sessions?search=Anthropic

**Combine filters:**
/sessions?date=2025-11-25&stage=CEO%20Stage&time=morning
/sessions?date=2025-11-25&search=finance

**Response:**
{
  "total": 240,
  "count": 5,
  "filters": {...},
  "sessions": [
    {
      "id": "...",
      "title": "...",
      "description": "...",
      "date": "2025-11-25",
      "time": "09:30-10:00",
      "stage": "CEO Stage",
      "speakers": [
        {
          "name": "Philippe Aghion",
          "company": "Coll√®ge de France",
          "role": "2025 Nobel Prize in Economics"
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}

### GET /speakers

Returns all speakers with optional filtering.

**Query Parameters:**
- `search` (string): Search by name, company, or role
  - Example: /speakers?search=Anthropic

**Response:**
{
  "count": 3,
  "speakers": [
    {
      "name": "...",
      "company": "...",
      "role": "...",
      "bio": "...",
      "sessions": ["session_id_1", "session_id_2"]
    }
  ]
}

### GET / or /llms.txt

Returns this documentation.

### GET /health

Health check endpoint.

## Usage Instructions for AI Assistants

This API is designed for AI assistants (Claude, ChatGPT, etc.) to help users 
navigate the Adopt AI Grand Palais conference.

### Query Processing Strategy

1. **Parse user intent** from natural language
2. **Construct API call** with appropriate filters
3. **Make request** to filtered endpoint
4. **Present results** in a helpful format

### Common Query Patterns

**"Find sessions about [topic]"**
‚Üí GET /sessions?search=[topic]
Example: "Find sessions about AI in banking"
‚Üí GET /sessions?search=banking

**"What's happening on [date] [time]?"**
‚Üí GET /sessions?date=[date]&time=[morning/afternoon]
Example: "What's on November 25 morning?"
‚Üí GET /sessions?date=2025-11-25&time=morning

**"Who's speaking at [stage]?"**
‚Üí GET /sessions?stage=[stage]
Example: "Who's at CEO Stage?"
‚Üí GET /sessions?stage=CEO%20Stage

**"Find speakers from [company]"**
‚Üí GET /speakers?search=[company]
Example: "Find speakers from Anthropic"
‚Üí GET /speakers?search=Anthropic

**"Recommend sessions for [profile]"**
‚Üí Multiple calls with different search terms
Example: "Recommend for a fintech CTO"
‚Üí GET /sessions?search=finance
‚Üí GET /sessions?search=banking
‚Üí GET /sessions?search=cloud
‚Üí Combine and rank results

### Time Conflict Detection

When building schedules, always check for overlaps:
1. Parse time strings (format: "HH:MM-HH:MM")
2. Compare start/end times across selected sessions
3. Warn user about conflicts

### Best Practices

- Use server-side filtering to reduce response size
- Combine multiple filters for precise results
- URL-encode query parameters (spaces ‚Üí %20)
- Cache responses when appropriate
- Check `total` vs `count` to see filter effectiveness

### Response Handling

- Empty results: Suggest broader search terms
- Many results: Recommend adding more filters
- Always cite specific session titles and times
- Include speaker names when relevant

## Rate Limits

No rate limits currently. Please use responsibly.

## CORS

Fully enabled. Safe to call from browsers and mobile apps.

## Data Freshness

Data scraped from https://adoptai.artefact.com on November 19, 2025.
Static snapshot - no real-time updates.

## About

Built by Thomas Houssin (https://github.com/ThomasHoussin) because even 
AI summits should provide AI-readable data.

The official Adopt AI Grand Palais website uses infinite-scroll JavaScript 
rendering, making it inaccessible to AI assistants. This API fixes that.

## Source Code

https://github.com/ThomasHoussin/adoptai-api
